body:
Removing CMakeLists.txt or Makefile.tpl looks good idea.

Personally I'm not a fan of `cmake`, but `cmake` looks better option in this case, since we don't need to build all source files from scratch when we modified a file.
normal Makefile can also detect file modification including header files by using -MMD option of gcc.

issue.title: Choose make or cmake to maintaine for DLK

repository.name: blueoil
repository.description: Bring Deep Learning to small devices

issue.body:
Currently, [blueoil convert](https://github.com/blue-oil/blueoil/blob/master/blueoil/cmd/convert.py#L73) run `make` command with `Makefile` created by generate_project.py.
DLK test([test_code_generation.py](https://github.com/blue-oil/blueoil/blob/master/dlk/tests/test_code_generation.py#L364-L380)) run `make` command with `Makefile` overwritten by `cmake` command.
To get library files, there are two methods by using `cmake` or not. And one(directly make) is not tested(maintained) and another(cmake -> make) is tested but not used by `blueoil convert` interface.

I think we should choose one method to maintain. Which one is used well by developers?ðŸ¤”
If `cmake` is selected, we should change `blueoil convert` to use `cmake` and it is better to remove [Makefile.tpl](https://github.com/blue-oil/blueoil/blob/master/dlk/python/dlk/templates/Makefile.tpl) to avoid confusing.
If make is selected, change dlk test to use make directly and try to remove cmake settings to avoid confusing.

body:
@tkng @primenumber 
Hi, is there any decision about this?
I found that one(directly make) is not tested(not well maintained) and another(cmake -> make) is tested but not used by `blueoil convert` interface.
So we should choose one method and change DLK tests or `blueoil convert` interface.

I have a comment.
I guess normal Makefile is enough for our project if `-MMD` option of g++ can recognize dependency well between `.cpp` and `.hpp`.
In addition that, `Makefile.tpl` can be normal `Makefile` if we simply check some file exist or not.
It's a similar way of current `CMakeLists.txt`.

In #588, Makefile is now plain text.
I think current CMakeLists.txt can be totally replaced nornal Makefile.
I think that if dlk will introduce complex build sequence, cmake might be better, but otherwise normal Makefile is better.

issue.title: Delete cmake dependency

repository.name: blueoil
repository.description: Bring Deep Learning to small devices

issue.body:
## What this patch does to fix the issue.
This PR removes dependency for `cmake`.
Test should be modified to use `make` instead of `cmake`.

## Link to any relevant issues or pull requests.
Fix #436 
Fix #542

issue.title: Clean Up Makefile of Runtime

repository.name: blueoil
repository.description: Bring Deep Learning to small devices

issue.body:
## What this patch does to fix the issue.
* This patch cleans up Makefile of runtime
* This enables easier way to add the new supported architecture
* The options for make is also changed
* This add new feature and it can detect changed header file correctly

## Link to any relevant issues or pull requests.
Fix #1006
